post.summary:
Create an Authorization Code flow Client. No Secret will be generated for this
            Client.

400.description: Missing or invalid inputs, or Client limit exceeded.

get.summary:
Get all Authorization Code clients from a Tenant.
            Optionally, get a list of requested clients. Total number
            of clients in the Tenant set in the Total-Count header.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unordered list of ids for all clients to get. Empty or whitespace Ids will be ignored.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Only return Clients that have these tags.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query to execute. Currently not supported.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of clients to skip. From query.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of clients to return.

head.summary:
Return total number of Authorization Code clients in a Tenant.
            Optionally, check based on a list of requested clients. The
            value will be set in the Total-Count header. This endpoint
            is identical to the GET one but it does not return any objects
            in the body.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unordered list of ids for all clients to get. Empty or whitespace Ids will be ignored.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Only count Clients that have these tags.

put.summary:
Update an Authorization Code Client. It can take up to one hour
            for update to manifest in the authentication process.

requestBody.description: Updated Authorization Code Client values. Properties that are not set or are null will not be changed.

get.summary: Get an Authorization Code Client from Tenant.

delete.summary:
Delete an Authorization Code Client. It can take up to one hour
            for deletion to manifest in the authentication process. Access
            tokens issued to this client will be valid until their expiration.

head.summary: Validate that an Authorization Code Client exists in Tenant.

200.description: Header for specified Authorization Code Client.

Send consent for an Azure Active Directory Tenant. OSIsoft Cloud Services needs to be granted
            permission to interact with the Azure Active Directory tenant. Otherwise, users from this Azure Active Directory Tenant

            [here](https://pisquare.osisoft.com/docs/DOC-3986-msa-consent-for-azure-active-directory).

post.summary:
Create a Client Credential Client. A Client Id and Client Secret will be generated to perform
            authentication. Make sure to store the Secret somewhere safe as we do not store the
            actual value after the creation step. If you do not have access to the Secret value, we suggest
            deleting the Secret and adding a new one for this Client. Clients have unique Ids in a Tenant.
            Currently there is a limit of 50000 clients (of all types) per Tenant.

201.description: Client Credential Client details for Client Credential Client created.

400.description: Missing or invalid inputs, or Client limit exceeded.

get.summary:
Get a list of Client Credential clients from a Tenant.
            Optionally, get a list of requested clients. Total number
            of clients in the Tenant set in the Total-Count header.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unordered list of Client Credential Client Ids. Empty, whitespace or null Ids will be ignored.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Only return Clients that have these tags.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query to execute. Currently not supported.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of clients to skip. Will be ignored if a list of Ids is passed.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of clients to return. Will be ignored if a list of Ids is passed.

head.summary:
Return total number of Client Credential clients in a Tenant.
            Optionally, check based on a list of requested clients. The
            value will be set in the Total-Count header. This endpoint
            is identical to the GET one but it does not return any objects
            in the body.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unordered list of Client Credential Client Ids. Empty, whitespace or null Ids will be ignored.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Only count Clients that have these tags.

put.summary:
Update a Client Credential Client. It can take up to one hour
            for these values to manifest in the authentication process.

requestBody.description: ClientCredentialClient object. Properties that are not set or are null will not be changed.

get.summary: Get a Client Credential Client.

delete.summary:
Delete a Client Credential Client. It can take up to one hour
            for deletion to manifest in the authentication process. Access
            tokens issued to this Client will be valid until their expiration.

head.summary:
Validate that a Client Credential Client exists.
            This endpoint is identical to the GET one but
            it does not return any objects in the body.

parameters.description: Sets the page size of results.

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: Retrieves the next page of results from result sets that span multiple pages.

parameters.description: Retrieves the next page of results from result sets that span multiple pages.

get.summary:
Get a list of users from a Tenant. Optionally, get a list of requested users.
            Total number of users in the Tenant set in the Total-Count header.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unordered list of User Ids to get.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query to execute. Currently not supported.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of users to skip. Ignored if a list of Ids is passed.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of users to return. Ignored if a list of Ids is passed.

post.summary:
Create a User in the Tenant. This endpoint does not create an invitation for the User.
            You will need to create an invitation in the respective endpoint for this User, otherwise
            they will not be able to finish the sign-up process. Users have unique Ids in a Tenant.
            Currently there is a limit of 50000 users per Tenant.
            For Windows Active Directory users, the externalUserId must be specified.

400.description: Missing or invalid inputs, or the User limit exceeded for Tenant.

head.summary:
Return total number of users in a Tenant. Optionally, check based on a list of requested users.
            The value will be set in the Total-Count header. This endpoint is identical to the GET one but
            it does not return any objects in the body.

get.summary:
Get invitation statuses for multiple users. Optionally
            restrict it only to users of a specific invitation status.
            The User status can be: InvitationAccepted (0),  NoInvitation (1),
            InvitationNotSent (2), InvitationSent (3), InvitationExpired (4).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unordered list of User Ids to get.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query to execute. Currently not supported.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of users to skip. Ignored if a list of Ids is passed.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of users to return. Ignored if a list of Ids is passed.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Only return statuses that match these values. Possible User statuses are: InvitationAccepted, NoInvitation, InvitationNotSent, InvitationSent, InvitationExpired.

get.summary: Get a User from Tenant.

put.summary: Update a User in a Tenant. The Id of a User cannot be changed.

requestBody.description: UserCreateOrUpdate object. Properties that are not set or are null will not be changed.

delete.summary:
Delete a User. Users cannot delete themselves. Deleting a User does not invalidate any of the
            existing access tokens, but it prevents this User from being able to authenticate in the future.
            Existing access tokens for the User will be valid until their expiration date. Refresh tokens on
            behalf of the User will no longer be valid after the User has been deleted. Deleting a user with 
            explicit and claim role mappings will only have their explicit roles deleted. Forcibly deleting a user
            will delete a user completely regardless of claim role mappings.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Forcibly delete a User that can remain due to claim role mappings.

head.summary:
Validate that a User exists. This endpoint is identical to the GET
            one, but it does not return an object in the body.

get.summary:
Get invitation status for a User. It can be: InvitationAccepted (0),
            NoInvitation (1), InvitationNotSent (2), InvitationSent (3), InvitationExpired (4).

Get preferences from a User. User preferences can be any valid
            JSON object. A common use case is to store UI preferences for the User.

head.summary:
Validate that there are preferences for a User. This endpoint is identical
            to the GET one but it does not return any objects in the body.

get.summary: Returns an ordered list of User objects based on userId for a given tenant or a MultiStatusResponse with a list of User objects and a list of errors.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Unordered list of ids for all users to get.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query to execute. Currently not supported.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Items to skip. Currently not supported.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum items to return. Currently not supported.

get.summary: Returns an ordered list of UserStatus objects for a given tenant or a MultiStatusResponse with a list of UserStatus objects and a list of errors.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Unordered list of ids for all users.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query to execute. Currently not supported.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Items to skip. Currently not supported.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to retrieve. Currently not supported.

post.summary: Creates a `User` .

requestBody.description: User values to use during creating.

400.description: Missing or invalid inputs, or User limit exceeded.

get.summary: Get UserInformation for Authentication.

parameters.name: identityProviderSpecificUserId
parameters.description: Identity Provider Specific User Id. Ex. ExternalUserId for AD, ObjectId for AAD.

400.description: Missing or invalid inputs, or Client limit exceeded.

get.summary: Get UserInformation for Access Token Refresh.

400.description: Missing or invalid inputs, or Client limit exceeded.

get.summary: Returns an IdentityProviderConsent object.

parameters.name: idpTenantDomain
parameters.description: Identity Provider Tenant Domain. Mutually exclusive to idpTenantId. Currently only supports AAD Domain.

parameters.name: idpTenantId
parameters.description: Identity Provider Tenant Id. Mutually exclusive to idpTenantDomain. Currently only supports AAD Tenant Id.

404.description: Identity Provider or specified Aad Tenant not found.

get.summary: Returns the specified Role.

head.summary: Get header for a Role.

IdentityProviderClaimTypeName.description: Claim Type Name associated with an Identity Provider.

Id.description: Gets or sets the ID for this Claim Type Name.

TypeName.description: Gets or sets the Claim Type Name.

IdentityProviderId.description: Gets or sets the Identity Provider Id associated with this Claim Type Name.

ErrorResponse.description: Object returned whenever there is an error.

OperationId.description: Gets or sets operationId of action that caused the Error.

Reason.description: Gets or sets reason for the Error.

Resolution.description: Gets or sets what can be done to resolve the Error.

IdentityProviderClaim.description: Object representing a claim from an Identity Provider to map to a Role.

Id.description: Gets or sets the IdentityProvider Claim Id.

TypeName.description: Gets or sets the Type Name for this IdentityProvider Claim.

Value.description: Gets or sets the value for this IdentityProvider Claim.

RoleIds.description: Gets or sets a list of RoleIds that this claim on this IdentityProvider will map to.

IdentityProvider.description: The model for an Identity Provider in Identity Storage.

Id.description: Gets or sets id of an identity provider.

DisplayName.description: Gets or sets identity provider display name to use.

Scheme.description: Gets or sets the name of the cookie handler that will temporarily store the outcome of the external authentication.

UserIdClaimType.description: Gets or sets type of claim.

ClientId.description: Gets or sets the ClientId of the identity provider.

IsConfigured.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the identity provider has been configured.

Capabilities.description: Gets or sets the Capabilities of the identity provider.

IdentityProviderCapabilities.description: The model for the Capabilities of an Identity Provider in Identity Storage.

User.description: Gets or sets user level capabilities

Group.description: Gets or sets group level capabilities

IdentityProviderUserCapabilites.description: The model for the user level capabilities of an Identity Provider in Identity Storage.

SignIn.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether user sign-in is supported.

Invitation.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether authorization via the invitation flow is supported.

Search.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether user search is supported.

IdentityProviderGroupCapabilites.description: The model for the group level capabilities of an Identity Provider in Identity Storage.

Authorize.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether authorization via groups is supported.

Search.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether group search is supported.

allOf.description: Object used during Authorization Code Client creation.

AllowedCorsOrigins.description:
Gets or sets the values used by the default CORS policy service implementations to build a
CORS policy for JavaScript clients.

RedirectUris.description:
Gets or sets the allowed URIs to which return tokens or authorization codes can be returned.
Wildcards are ignored. URIs must match exactly what you are redirecting to
after login. If URIs do not match, the authentication process will fail
with a bad_client error.
Maximum 10 per client.

PostLogoutRedirectUris.description:
Gets or sets allowed URIs to redirect to after logout. Wildcards are ignored.
URIs must match exactly what you are redirecting to after logout.
Maximum 10 for client.

ClientUri.description: Gets or sets URI to a page with information about client (used on consent screen).

LogoUri.description: Gets or sets URI to client logo (used on consent screen).

Client.description: Base object used during Client creation.

Id.description: Gets or sets client ID for this client. This ID should be a GUID.

Name.description: Gets or sets name of Client.

Enabled.description:
Gets or sets whether client is enabled. Client can be used for authentication
if set to true. Client cannot be used for authentication if set to false.

AccessTokenLifetime.description:
Gets or sets lifetime of access token issued for this client after authentication.
Minimum 60 seconds. Maximum 3600 seconds. Defaults to 3600 seconds.

Tags.description: Gets or sets for OSIsoft internal use only.

allOf.description: Object to get or update a Client Credential Client.

RoleIds.description:
Gets or sets list of Roles to be assigned to this client. Member role is always required.
For security reasons we advise against assigning Admin roles to a client.

AzureActiveDirectoryTenant.description: The model for an Azure Active Directory Tenant in Identity Storage.

Id.description: Gets or sets id of an Azure Active Directory Tenant.

ConsentState.description: Gets or sets Consent State of Azure Active Directory Tenant. Can be: NotConsented (0), Consented (1).

Domain.description: Gets or sets Domain of Azure Active Directory Tenant.

ConsentInformation.description: Information about the recipient of the Azure Active Directory consent email.

AzureActiveDirectoryConsentEmail.description: Gets or sets address to email consent.

AzureActiveDirectoryConsentGivenName.description: Gets or sets preferred name to use in the consent email.

AzureActiveDirectoryConsentSurname.description: Gets or sets preferred surname to use in the consent email.

AzureActiveDirectoryTenant.description: Gets or sets Azure Active Directory Domain Name (e.g. mydomain.onmicrosoft.com).

AzureActiveDirectoryConsentTypes.description:
Gets or sets Azure Active Directory Consent Types.  
Valid Consent Type combinations include "SignIn" and "SignIn;ReadAllUsersGroups".

ClientCredentialClientCreateResponse.description: Secret information returned after a Client Credential Client is created.

Description.description: Gets or sets description for the initial secret for the client.

ExpirationDate.description: Gets or sets expiration date for the initial secret for the client.

Client.description: Gets or sets client Client Credential Client created.

SecretDescription.description:
Gets or sets description for the initial secret for the client. Ensure that this is descriptive enough,
as it will be the only way to distinguish between multiple secrets and their usage for a
client.

SecretExpirationDate.description:
Gets or sets expiration date for the initial secret for the client. If set to null the secret will
never expire. We advise against such practice.

ClientCredentialClientMultiStatusRespons.description: MultiStatusResponse objects returned in a 207 response.

OperationId.description: Gets or sets operationId that resulted in this error.

Error.description: Gets or sets string message describing the error.

Reason.description: Gets or sets reason that caused the error.

ChildErrors.description: Gets or sets list of ChildErrors.

allOf.description: ChildError objects returned in a 207 response.

StatusCode.description: Gets or sets hTTP status code.

Id.description: Gets or sets id for this Secret.

ClientSecretCreateOrUpdate.description: Object to write a Client Secret.

Expiration.description: Gets or sets expiration date for the client secret. Will be null if the secret does not expire.

Expires.description:
Gets or sets determines if the secret expires. Defaults to true.
If Expires is set to true (or null) and Expiration is not null, expiration of this secret will be enforced.
If Expires is set to true (or null) and Expiration is null, a 400 error will be returned.
If Expires is set to false and Expiration is not null, a 400 error will be returned.
If Expires is set to false and Expiration is null, there will be no expiration of this secret.

Description.description:
Gets or sets description for the client secret. We suggest being as descriptive as possible. This field will make identifying
secrets easier.

allOf.description: Object returned after a Client Secret is created.
Object used for Device Code Clients.

DeviceCodeLifetime.description: Gets or sets the lifetime of device codes in seconds.

ClientUri.description: Gets or sets URI to a page with information about client (used on consent screen).

LogoUri.description: Gets or sets URI to client logo (used on consent screen).

HybridClientCreateResponse.description: Secret information returned after a Hybrid Client is created.

Description.description: Gets or sets description for the initial secret for the client.

ExpirationDate.description: Gets or sets expiration date for the initial secret for the client.

Client.description: Gets or sets Hybrid Client object created.

AllowOfflineAccess.description: Gets or sets whether this client can request refresh tokens, by providing the *offline_access* scope.

AllowAccessTokensViaBrowser.description:
Gets or sets whether this HybridClient is allowed to receive access tokens via the browser.
This is useful to harden flows that allow multiple response types (e.g. by disallowing a hybrid flow
client that is supposed to use code *id_token* to add the *token* response type, thus
leaking the token to the browser).

allOf.description: Object used during Hybrid Client creation.

SecretDescription.description: Gets or sets description for the initial secret for the client.

SecretExpirationDate.description:
Gets or sets expiration date for the initial secret for the client. If set to null the secret will
never expire. We advise against such practice.

Value.description: Gets or sets the value for this IdentityProvider Claim.

IdentityProviderClaimTypeNameId.description: Gets or sets the Identity Provider Claim Type Name Id for this IdentityProvider Claim.

RoleIds.description: Gets or sets the list of Role Ids associated with this IdentityProviderClaim.

IdentityProviderClaimUpdate.description: Update information for an IdentityProvider Claim.

Value.description: Gets or sets the value for this IdentityProvider Claim.

RoleIds.description: Gets or sets the list of Role Ids associated with this IdentityProviderClaim.

IdentityProviderConsent.description: The model for an Identity Provider Consent in Identity Storage.

Scheme.description: Gets or sets the scheme of the Identity Provider.

allOf.description: Object for adding an Identity Provider.

IdentityProviderId.description: Gets or sets Identity Provider Id to Add.

AzureActiveDirectorySendConsent.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether send consent email for Azure Active Directory.

IdentityProviderResultsOfIdentityProvide.description: Result object for Identity Provider access users/groups.

IdentityProviderUser.description: Base class for Identity provider access user.

Id.description: Gets or sets Id of user.

GivenName.description: Gets or sets given name of user.

Surname.description: Gets or sets surname of user.

Name.description: Gets or sets name of user.

Email.description: Gets or sets email of user.

IdentityProviderResultsOfIdentityProvide.description: Result object for Identity Provider access users/groups.

IdentityProviderGroup.description: Base class for Identity Provider access group.

Id.description: Gets or sets the Object Id of IdentityProviderGroup.

Name.description: Gets or sets group name of IdentityProviderGroup.

Email.description: Gets or sets the email address of the IdentityProviderGroup.

IdentityProviderMembers.description: Class to hold members in a group.

allOf.description: Object used during Implicit Client creation.

AllowedCorsOrigins.description:
Gets or sets the values used by the default CORS policy service implementations to build a
CORS policy for JavaScript clients.
Maximum 10 for client.

TenantId.x-deprecatedMessage: TenantId will be removed in the next release. Please remove references to it.

Id.description: Gets or sets unique User ID.

GivenName.description: Gets or sets given name of user.

Surname.description: Gets or sets surname of user.

Name.description: Gets or sets name of user.

Email.description: Gets or sets email of user.

ContactEmail.description:
Gets or sets contact email for user. User will only be contacted
through this email.

ContactGivenName.description: Gets or sets preferred contact name for user.

ContactSurname.description: Gets or sets preferred contact surname for user.

ExternalUserId.description:
Gets or sets provider id for user. This is the unique ID we
get from the Identity Provider.

IdentityProviderId.description:
Gets or sets Identity Provider Id used to authenticate User.
Will be set once the User accepts an invitation.
If not specified when sending the invitation to
the User, it can be any of the Identity Provider
Ids configured for this Tenant.

RoleIds.description: Gets or sets list of strings of RoleIds.

UserMultiStatusResponse.description: MultiStatusResponse objects returned in a 207 response.

OperationId.description: Gets or sets operationId that resulted in this error.

Error.description: Gets or sets string message describing the error.

Reason.description: Gets or sets reason that caused the error.

ChildErrors.description: Gets or sets list of ChildErrors.

UserStatus.description: Object used when getting User status.

InvitationStatus.description: Gets or sets status of user invitation. Can be: InvitationAccepted (0),  NoInvitation (1), InvitationNotSent (2), InvitationSent (3), InvitationExpired (4).

Id.description: Gets or sets user Id for the user. When creating a user, if User ID is not specified, one will be generated.

ExternalUserId.description: Gets or sets user ExternalUserId for the user. Must be specified if Identity Provider is Windows Active Directory.

ContactGivenName.description: Gets or sets preferred name to be used when contacting user.

ContactSurname.description: Gets or sets preferred surname to be used when contacting user.

ContactEmail.description: Gets or sets preferred contact email to be used. This does not have to be the same as the user's Identity Provider email.

IdentityProviderId.description:
Gets or sets Identity Provider this user will be required to use to login.  If null, the Identity Provider Id will
be set when creating the Invitation.

IdentityProviderSpecificUserId.description: Identity Provider Specific User Id. Ex. ObjectId for AD and AAD.

RoleIds.description: Gets or sets list of strings of RoleIds.

UserStatusMultiStatusResponse.description: MultiStatusResponse objects returned in a 207 response.

OperationId.description: Gets or sets operationId that resulted in this error.

Error.description: Gets or sets string message describing the error.

Reason.description: Gets or sets reason that caused the error.

ChildErrors.description: Gets or sets list of ChildErrors.
